Reviews.Content: Good place to stay Rooms were a tad small but we made do since we spent time only in our hotel rooms at night ie for sleeping. Housekeeping drops by daily in our 5 days 4 nights stay at the hotel with fresh towels. So rooms were pretty clean. A factor in favour of Shamrock is its location. Loved its location which is beside the Jordan MTR station as it facilitates our travelling. Furthermore, there are food aplenty in the area around Shamrock Hotel, serving Chinese cuisines. So getting food around the area is easy.
Reviews.Author: TravelBug1081

Reviews.Content: Nice location Good value for money because of the location and price. Close to Jordan MTR and Temple Street.
Reviews.Author: lakersiul

Reviews.Content: Worst. Ever Aptly named. Indeed a sham. The room is the tiniest I've ever lived in. The bed is in the centre of the room. 5 inches in front is the telly, which doesn't have CNN. 5 inches to the left is the wall. and 5 inches to the left is the toilet. And oh, 5 inches diagonally is the door. Let's not even talk about how dirty it is or whether it has internet connection (of course it doesn't).
Reviews.Author: bcheong

Reviews.Content: Good Value 4 money Its good value for money , Best Location right on Nathan Road just next to Jordan mrt , near ladies market n jade market,Good clean rooms, except size of the room is not a problem, toilet are especially clean but bit small, but loction of hotel saved us lot of the time n engery, Overall its good hotel, Recommended to people for whom location matters than luxury of the room
Reviews.Author: SmitaFaagun

Reviews.Content: Good location hotel! ..I had booked my stay at Shamrock hotel in Hong Kong online July at shamrockhotel.com.hk. They replied immediately. I did not regret booking this hotel because it is beside the Jordan Station or MTR which saves you time and energy because you will do a lot of walking in Hong Kong. It's hard to get around when your hotel is far from the MTR.We stayed there end of August and they reserved a De luxe room with 2 double bed for the 4 of us in one room, with a prize of just 1280 HK$ per night including a great buffet breakfast for 3. You will enjoy their breakfast with variety of food from ham, salad, cereal, dimsum, noodles, fried fish fillet etc. They all taste good!The room is surprisingly big although it has an old fashioned design. I heard that hotel rooms in Hong kong are very small but this one is not. The double bed can accomodate 2 people very well. And the room has a lot of space for moving around. I just don't know if this is also the case with their standard rooms...It includes a long sofa with table, a small meal area with 2 chairs and another table, a big cabinet with surprisingly a metal Bank Safe for money or jewelries. The toilet has a bath tub with no hair dryer, but good enough. So be sure to bring your own hair dryer but request for an adaptor for their socket. They also supplied us with fresh towels on a daily basis. The staff are okay, some are arrogant but most of them are accomodating with your questions. I would definitely go to this hotel again.
Reviews.Author: cititourist

Reviews.Content: BEST 3 STAR HOTEL       Toilet
Reviews.Author: Magwill

Reviews.Content: awesome to stay!       with one of the employees whom i luv to befriend with..he's really very generous and friendly.
Reviews.Author: vanessabelle

Reviews.Content: Love Shamrock       Staircase
Reviews.Author: lilsweetcotton

Reviews.Content: too small!! hotel room's pretty clean, can't comment less on that....just that the space is soooooo small..several times i got bumped here and there, so watched out for that especially when you are getting a double bed. my husband is a 6 footer, so imagine how it made him suffer most.. he suggested to change room and upgrade to a larger one, but since we got there only to explore the place what is 3 nights of inconvenience? ( we booked for 4D 3N ) it turned out to be not a very good idea.. so if i were you and felt changing rooms, do it at once for a more comfortable stay..beware of the restaurant attendants, specially this tall woman that serves breakfast.. yes we know our breakfast was included in the package, but we'd like to eat buffet, so i told her we want buffet, she said no stay there, no buffet, just set whaaaaaaaaaaattt??? as if we are not going to pay? what's wrong with this people?? same thing happened on our third day, so i went to the frontdesk and made a complaint...  sorry for that ma'm we'll fix the problem right away,  yeah right ..just hope this thing won't happen again.. it felt humiliating, specially with those people hearing what this woman was saying, you would feel out of place.. good thing we had money to spend for a better service, but this was so unfair... really unfair
Reviews.Author: mamipapi2729

Reviews.Content: Convenience over luxury If you're a peninsula type of person, then I wouldn't recommend staying in The Samrock. But if you're after a place which is reasonably priced, good enough to serve your needs (you don't stay in hotel all the time after all), and is a stone's throw away from shopping establisments, then you may want to consider staying there. The rooms are considerably clean, although outdated, and the location is comfortably within a busy part of HK. The hotel staff are very friendly and accomodating. If you need to buy basic stuff, there are more than a couple of convenience stores nearby and restaurants all around. The nearest train station is just around the corner (Jordan) so getting to and from your destinations shouldn't be a problem. If you're a coffee addict, the Starbucks across the street should be a plus factor.
Reviews.Author: jmem

Reviews.Content: Convenience Though Old School Shamrock Hotel is not a sham, that's a fact. 'Stayed here last year with my family for our annual holiday break. It was a pleasant, the food was just fine but what i have noticed is they served the same food for breakfast. Also, not to mention one of our fellowmen got irritated with the server beacause she took away the guest's plate eventhough he is not yet done eating. The room was elegant though old fashioned. The bathroom is clean and without a doubt one of the best place in Hongkong (our hotel bathroom) due to cleanliness. The staff is approachable and helpful and you can even leave your things in the lobby, unharmed from any kind of thief. Do not be deceived or misled to the pictures that you are saw in their website. Seems to be that they have the advance and futuristic design but to see is to believe. From my point view, Shamrock Hotel needs a refurbishment, when we are talking about the interior. The former should be updated in terms of the design, which is by the way an indespensable one for the edifice. Location wise, is very comfortable. Situated just beside the Jordan MTR station, very convenient for the future and existing clients and shoppers. With due respect to the hotel, comfort, no frills, convenience, practical is the best adjective to describe this establishment. I'm giving it a grade of 7 out of 10. And 'really appreciate all the good service of them.
Reviews.Author: ilovesurewin

Reviews.Content: old fashioned very near to subway,convenient.Nice breakfast buffet,fair price,rooms are clean.But I really think they don't have much sense of beauty in decorating or interior design.They have wierd crystal light hanging under cheap ceilings in the room.Out-fashioned design seems was created decades ago. Strange and old fashioned carpet everywhere.Very old styled room door.I think the owner try to save money to hire a interior designer,and believe himself could be good interior designer.Well,the outcome seems to be wrong.I suggest they shouldn't save money for hiring a interior designer.
Reviews.Author: tingweng

Reviews.Content: clean, accessible, affordable . . . .       Hay...... Its time to go back home...
Reviews.Author: gen-md

Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and staff After our trip last March to HKG, we went back just this november...and the usual, the staff are friendly, attentive, fast service, the room we had superior triple room is very big...With complimentary fruits, daily morning paper, coffee and tea, plenty of supplies...The breakfast at the 10th floor is SUPER... FREE breakfast is included in our reservation, be prepared to go to the comfort room before you go to your shopping journey coz expect a heavy breakfast at their 10th floor... chix steak, ham and hotdog, croissant breads, salad, yoghurt, black berries, fried rice, pies, and many many more... but their chix steak rocks... you will always be greeted with pleasant smile from the staff... they will always assist you with everything... front desk/reception, bellmen, concierge, business ctr staff are just amazing... they are very very nice and they speak english well...we've been to other hotels in hongkong, but this one is uncomparable... in my next trip on may 2008, shamrock is still on my choice of hotel... i love the people there...
Reviews.Author: h0tpink20

Reviews.Content: Excellent, centrally located, reasonably priced hotel for Hong Kong We have just spent 5 days at the Shamrock - our first visit to Hong Kong. It proved an excellent choice. Why?Above all for location/price. At around 拢60 a night, it is cheap by Hong Kong standards. But it is very well located in downtown Kowloon on the bustling Nathan Road. You can walk to the Star Ferry terminal and nearby museums etc in less than 15 minutes. It is less than one minute's walk to Jordan MTR Station for rapid connections to Hong Kong Central and the whole network. The airport bus (line A21, cost HKD33 - do not take the more expensive so called flashier airport buses) stops virtually outside the hotel. And you also have nearby the bustling night market on Temple Street, with some decent and cheap open-air restaurants too (do visit 'Temple Spicy Crabs' - excellent!).The hotel's facilities are not extensive - no gym, sauna or such like. But the rooms, while not large, are clean and well kept. The staff were friendly and efficient with us. And the buffet breakfast in the modest looking 10th floor restaurant is surprisingly good, and is a snip at only HKD60 plus taxes. Do try it!All in all a very good, excellently located decent hotel for the cost-conscious visitor to Hong Kong. Ideal as a base to explore the territory from. We would go back - which is our highest praise.
Reviews.Author: AzUtazo

Reviews.Content: Clean,comfortable and central hotel Central hotel,easy to locate, on Nathan Rd. Cheap bus to airport just up the road. Smooth check in and out. Kowloon Park nearby pleasant and has a pool. TastyJapanese bakery almost next door to hotel. Wasn't sure what we were buying but it was mainly delicious and made for a cheap and filling breakfast. Hadn't tried red bean doughnuts before. Hong Kong is open all hours for shopping and eating. Extremely cheap meals;we ate in little cafes: bowls of noodles, meat and veg for no more than 拢2 a meal. Not good for vegetarians though or the faint hearted. Old Western district on HK Island v interesting as was tram ride. Transport cheap. Overall, Hong Kong brilliant and exciting, and Shamrock Hotel a good place to stay.
Reviews.Author: Rosie24Midlands

Reviews.Content: A Great Base When we came for a 5 night break to Hong Kong with our 2 children (8 and 9) we needed somewhere central and clean to sleep and shower. The Shamrock is in a fantastic location on Nathan road, near markets, shops and metros.Our room was serviced with clean sheets and towels daily. It wasn't a huge room but with 2 dble beds we were plesantly surprised and easily managed.There is a fairly standard breakfast room upstairs which serves altho not a huge variety there was enough and it certainly kept us going. I do recommend to take a jumper up with you in the mornings as sometimes we felt the A/C was very strong.Staff friendly and helpful.Anyhow, I would recommed this hotel to friends who wanted to spend time out enjoying HKG and need a hotel to base themselves at.
Reviews.Author: 4Gypsies

Reviews.Content: Small but Comvenient Hotel was well-hidden within the street...lobby was small but welcoming.. Checked in past midnight but there was no problems at all... room met all our requests e.g. non-smoking (even though only 2 levels were non-smoking levels) and 2 single beds..Room is a bit small... hardly any space to walk if the luggages were too big.. but it was self-contained..as in all toiletries were provided for... overall.. it was quite a cosy stay.. Reception staff were very helpful... could even provide info on the time of the masses and the tel nos for certain restaurants.. Last but not least, its just beside the MTR... so its really really convenient... Overall, value for money...
Reviews.Author: Cher_711

Reviews.Content: loved the shamrock My husband and I stayed at the Shamrock Hotel (Hong Kong) for six nights in july 07. The location is excellent all forms of transport on the doorstep. Shops and markets are plentiful and also nearby. The hotel was excellent the staff are most helpful.our room was excellent and spotless the maid changed sheets and towels daily and also replenished toiletries daily. Their is a safe in the bedroom that is free of charge also the mini-bar prices are the cheapest we have ever come across. If you are planning a trip to Hong Kong and want a great hotel bang in the middle shops,restaurants,markets and all modes of transport then book into the shamrock. Its the best.Ireane
Reviews.Author: suzie49

Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel Was in Shamrock in end May/early June 2005. Hotel was very good. Check-in was smooth, staff very friendly. Rooms are quite big (for HK hotels) and are very clean. No complains for this hotel.Hotel is just next to Nathan Road  Jordan MTR. Very convenient to get around.
Reviews.Author: sebastianc

Reviews.Content: Fantastic location! I am so glad the travel agent recommended this hotel. It's not particularly big or new, but makes up for all that and more with its location, location, location!The hotel's less than a stone's throw away from Jordan MTR, which is great for mid-day breaks: Shop, drop off the bags, and it's off to the shops again! Also, there's the convenience and draw of good and cheap food in the neighbourhood.We stayed in a room with two single beds the first night, and that was small though adequate. The other three nights we moved to a larger room with a double bed and a lovely view of the bustling streets below. Both rooms were clean and gave us enough room to sprawl our shopping about.Service also was warm and prompt... though the airport transfer ran slightly late both upon arrival and when departing.Yep, there's no doubt about it: I'll definitely return to Shamrock!
Reviews.Author: HowToGetToSesameSt

Reviews.Content: all good. I stayed in the hotel for four nights, from June 15 to June 19. As for location, overall it was great, the hotel is near everything - the bus stop is right in front of the hotel doors, the Jordan MTR station is just around the corner, walk a couple of blocks and you're at the Bowring Street Market. Walk further from Bowring and you're at Temple Road. Park Lane is also near, walk a few blocks from the hotel's entrance and you're there. Needless to say, the Nathan Rd area is very well lit, so going around at night shouldn't be much of a problem.For those on tight budgets, convenience stores are in the area, there are about 2 7-Eleven's that are within walking distance, and a couple of Circle K's as well. Small Chinese restaurants are in the area too, if you want the whole authentic Chinese-cooked food experience. :-)The rooms, although small, are very clean, comfortable and well lit. The airconditioning works well, making the room even more comfortable. As expected, the room's bathroom is small, it was rather difficult to move around, especially when you're in a hurry to go somewhere. The room that I got didn't have windows though, aside from the frosted-glass panels in the bathroom. The staff are very friendly, always ready to answer questions and entertain requests. I didn't plan on staying inside the hotel room for long, I was there to sleep, take a shower, and keep my shopping safe. Shamrock provided all that, so it was all good. Next time I visit HK, I'd definitely stay in Shamrock.
Reviews.Author: adrienne02

Reviews.Content: Hotel was fine I stayed here for four nights in late April. The price we paid was a little dear for this hotel. However I think we could have done better if we used an alternative booking method for the same hotel. The rooms are small but adequate. The bed however was too small for comfort. We ordered a double, it was a very small double. Infact I wondered was it a double? The room were clean and small additions like toothbrushes etc were there also. I often forget mine. We got the bus from the airport and this landed us right outside the hotel which is brilliant when you are tired after the flight. The location of the hotel is good. It would be a hotel I wouldnt remember but that is as much a positive as a negative.
Reviews.Author: dodgyme

Reviews.Content: Great location, excellent service We were only staying one night in HK before heading to the mainland, and wanted an inexpensive place in a convenient location. We took a chance on the Shamrock and had no regrets. Travelling with a young baby, convenience was important. The hotel is right on the A22 bus line from the airport, which is another easy option for getting into Kowloon. It was pouring rain when we arrived with our many bags and stroller, but the concierge came across the street with umbrellas for us and helped take our luggage to the hotel. The rooms are small (to be expected in this location and price range) but clean and comfortable. There isn't a lot of room for bags in the room, but for 1 night it was fine. The hotel also provided us with a baby cot at no extra charge. The staff were always helpful and courteous. There is a restaurant in the hotel, and a breakfast dining room. There is also a nice bakery a few doors down if you prefer a lighter and cheaper breakfast. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Shamrock to anyone looking for something better than a guesthouse but not as fancy as a 4 star hotel.
Reviews.Author: PIYL

Reviews.Content: Looking for a Great Value Hotel in HK?       dresser
Reviews.Author: KXPlorer

Reviews.Content: Top location I stayed here in late November 06, and chose the Shamrock for it's location on Nathan Road in Kowloon. With the MTR and Nathan Road buses steps away I didn't take a single cab during my stay. There are plenty of nearby places to eat and the Night Market is also a short walk. My single room was basic  small but I didn't spend much time there other than to sleep. Most importantly it was very clean.I would stay there again.
Reviews.Author: soundguyo

Reviews.Content: Small, small, small We had a three night stay at the hotel and I will stick to my review title.. small... in both good and not so good ways. It was a pleasure trip that coincided with Hong Kong's 10th anniversary. So almost every place you go was packed, hotels, parks, everywhere.We were a party of four (two couples) and had no prior arrangements aside from getting two rooms. There was a lot of people at the lobby but we got through the queue in a small amount of time. 10mins, tops. We asked to have the two rooms next to each other. Being in the busy season, we did not get that. Same floor though.The rooms were indeed small, however, it was designed in way that there would still be enough space for you to walk around. It did not look cluttered. So, small bath, small closet, small frig, small tv. Just enough for a three night stay if you're going to spend most of the day outside anyway.The staff was excellent. They were very helpful in so many ways. The housekeeper even returned money that was found in our room after we checked out even though we left the room in total disarray. It was just a couple of US$ but we certainly appreciated the gesture. (and yes she got praise/reward for that)The location was excellent! It took a small time for us to get everywhere. The bus stop was literally outside the lobby. Jordan station was around the corner. Night shopping, 7/11, food stalls were just around us.
Reviews.Author: theJourneyBegins

Reviews.Content: Way only three lousy stars??? This place "rocks"!!!!   showReview(6799339, 'full');
Reviews.Author: DonClipper

Reviews.Content: Good Location       Hotel Exterior
